text: Consecrated on September 7, 1949 by Swami Prabhavananda, the Ramakrishna Monastery is located on a 40-acre property in the rolling hills of Trabuco Canyon, California. It bears the name of the great Indian mystic, Sri Ramakrishna, founder of the Ramakrishna Order of India. The Ramakrishna Monastery is part of the Vedanta Society of Southern California and is a Western branch of the Ramakrishna Order of India. ==References== == External links == * Ramakrishna Monastery, Trabuco Canyon - details Category:Orange County, California Category:Hindu temples in California Category:Indian- American culture in California Category:Religious buildings and structures in Orange County, California Category:1949 establishments in California Category:Buildings and structures in Orange County, California Category:Hinduism in the United States
title: Vedanta Society Of Southern California, Ramakrishna Monastery
